summary: Comprehensive documentation coverage - no significant gaps identified

cli_commands.notes: All CLI commands (analyze, validate, compare, init, validate-improvement) are documented

core_analysis.notes: Complexity metrics, parsers, and analyzers are thoroughly covered

debt_detection.notes: All debt patterns, code smells, and error handling patterns are documented

responsibility_analysis.notes: SRP detection, responsibility inference, and god object detection are covered

boilerplate_detection.notes: Pattern detection, trait analysis, and boilerplate scoring are explained

risk_assessment.notes: Risk scoring, prioritization, and impact analysis are comprehensive

output_formats.notes: JSON, markdown, and terminal formats are documented

configuration.notes: Config options, file formats, and defaults are well-covered

architecture.notes: Data flow, pipelines, and system design are explained

advanced_features.notes: All advanced analysis features have dedicated chapters

validation_and_comparison.notes: Quality gates and comparison workflows are covered

prodigy_integration.notes: Automated workflows and map-reduce integration documented

recommendations.description: Continue to update documentation as new features are added
recommendations.rationale: Current documentation is comprehensive and well-structured

recommendations.description: Consider adding more real-world examples in the Examples chapter
recommendations.rationale: While all features are documented, additional practical examples could enhance learning
Improve discoverability by linking related concepts across chapters

conclusion: The Debtmap book documentation is comprehensive and well-structured. All major feature areas identified in the codebase analysis (features.json) are documented with dedicated chapters. No new chapter stubs need to be created at this time.
